name: Old Quarter Street Exploration
description: Walk through narrow streets, visit Ta Hien Corner and Beer Street, explore traditional shop houses
tips: Visit in evening for best atmosphere

name: Train Street Coffee Experience
description: Enjoy coffee inches from active train tracks. Train runs every 2 hours. Since 2022, police guard access - wait at Tran Phu street barricade for shop keeper to motion you over
tips: Duck behind walls when police look

name: Water Puppet Show
description: Traditional Vietnamese art form with puppets performing on water

name: Ha Giang Loop Motorbike Tour
description: 3-day motorbike tour through UNESCO Geopark with 17 ethnic groups. Most scenic route in Vietnam with limestone cliffs, rice terraces, and mountain villages
tips: Book small group tours (3 bikes vs 10-20)
Choose 'easy rider' option if not experienced
Weather can be foggy - pack warm clothes

name: Dong Van Karst Plateau
description: UNESCO Geopark with prehistoric ocean remnants from 380 million years ago. Highest human diversity in the world with 17 ethnic groups

name: Quan Ba Heaven Gate
description: Spectacular mountain viewpoint, often foggy but breathtaking when clear

name: Cat Ba National Park
description: Explore Hang Quan Hospital Cave (Vietnam War bomb-proof hospital), Dong Trung Trang Cave, and hike to Dinh Ngu Lam Peak

name: Lan Ha Bay Boat Cruise
description: Luxury 3-deck boat cruise with kayaking through caves, limestone cliffs, floating fishing villages, and fresh seafood lunch
tips: Alternative to crowded Ha Long Bay

name: Bai Dinh Pagoda
description: Largest Buddhist temple complex in Vietnam with massive golden Buddha statues

name: Hang Mua Pagoda Viewpoint
description: Steep 500-step climb to pagodas with sweeping sunset views of rice fields and limestone cliffs

name: Imperial City (Citadel)
description: Vast walled ancient capital with temples, corridors, gardens, and royal crafts. UNESCO World Heritage site

name: Thien Mu Pagoda
description: Active Buddhist monastery where monk Thic Quang Duc lived before his 1963 protest. Sunset gathering spot with silky tofu and honey ginger sauce

name: Mausoleum of Emperor Tu Duc
description: Large outdoor complex of tombs, temples and rivers filled with koi fish

name: Hai Van Pass Motorbike Ride
description: Scenic 20km coastal mountain road from Hue to Hoi An. Featured on Top Gear. Includes stops at markets, waterfalls, and viewpoints
tips: Most difficult part is Da Nang traffic

name: Cam Thanh Family Cooking Class
description: Market tour, basket boat experience, crab fishing, and hands-on cooking of spring rolls, papaya salad, clay pot fish, and banh xeo

name: Basket Boat Tour
description: Round bamboo boats through coconut mangroves with crab fishing experience

name: Full Moon Lantern Festival
description: Monthly festival where city dims lights, only paper lanterns shine. Riverboat rides and lantern releases to honor deceased

name: Marble Mountains
description: Steep cliffs with beautiful pagodas and caves housing Buddha statues and prayer altars. Surrounding shops sell marble statues and precious stones

name: Ba Na Hills Golden Bridge
description: French-built amusement park with famous bridge held up by giant hands. Reclaimed by Vietnamese

name: Ben Thanh Market
description: Famous central market for souvenirs, local food, and bargaining

name: District 1 Rooftop Bar Crawl
description: Sunset viewing from multiple rooftop bars in the central district

name: Cu Chi Tunnels
description: Underground tunnel network used during Vietnam War
